attributes.action: Consider building a MP's apartment complex in London to save taxpayers money
attributes.additional_details: At the moment the Government allows MP's to claim a maximum of £150 a night for hotels in the capital if all 650 MPS used the maximum allowance just 16 times a month the bill would come to an astonishing £1.57million a month for the British tax payer. If the Government was to build a complex for MP's there would be no need for rent expenses and over the years the tax payer would make a huge saving which could then be invested on the vulnerable in society.
attributes.background: Taxpayers currently pay for MP's housing in London through MP's expenses. If the Government were to invest in building a apartment building solely for MP's and other government officials this would save the tax payer money in the long run and would stop abuse of expenses through Rent.
